title: Party bus carrying strippers from Melbourne club crashes with a truck in Dubbo the bus driver
text:
His passenger and the truck driver were treated for non-life-threatening injuries

The driver of the 'stripper bus on wheels' from Kittens stripclub died at the scene

A man has died after the stripper bus he was driving collided with a truck near Dubbo in the NSW Central West on Tuesday morning.

A semi-trailer transporting gravel and the Kittens Stripclub bus collided on Peak Hill Road, five kilometres south of Dubbo, at 7.45am.

The driver of the 'stripper bus on wheels' died at the scene after paramedics couldn't revive him. His passenger was treated for non-life-threatening injuries.

The man behind the wheel of the truck is being treated for minor injuries.

A semi-trailer transporting gravel and the Kittens Stripclub bus collided on Peak Hill Road, five kilometres south of Dubbo, at 7.45am

The driver of the 'stripper bus on wheels' died at the scene after paramedics couldn't revive him

Police will remain on scene for some time with the Newell Highway closed in both directions while Police Forensic Officers investigate the scene

Police and rescue units will remain on scene for some time with the Newell Highway closed in both directions while Police Forensic Officers investigate the scene.

Orana Mid Western Police District Commander Keith Ridley said it's not yet known what led to the deadly collision, and it hasn't been determined how the bus ended up on the wrong side of the road.

'At this stage I can't indicate if it was overtaking or if it was drifting onto the incorrect side of the road,' he said.

'It was a very chaotic scene, obviously a truck and bus impacting at the speed limit created quite a bit of carnage.

'The injury to one of the drivers was quite severe... it was quite a harrowing scene for all emergency first responders.

Motorists can expect lengthy delays, with road blocks in place at Obley Road and south on the highway.

The 'strip club on wheels' promises to take clients on a 'wild night you'll never forget,' according to the Kittens website.

'Featuring industry leading sound system complete with deejay setup, the Party Bus has a fully decked out interior with blacked out roof for that club feeling – A strip club on wheels.'

'With packages to suit virtually every budget, Kittens will help you and your guests get to where you need to go, and party along the way! Melbourne has never seen a Party Bus quite like this before!'
description: A man has died after the stripper bus he was driving collided with a truck near Dubbo in the NSW Central West on Tuesday morning.
authors: Alana Mazzoni For Daily Mail Australia
